title: Platform Engineer with a passion to secure application flows | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Are you passionate about Web Application Firewall (WAF) and Network security solutions? Join our digital transformation!
   

  

 At SEB we are embarking on an exciting tech transformation journey and are seeking a talented, motivated and security aware Platform Engineer to join our Web Application Firewall Team. If you have a passion for infrastructure development & maintenance, and the desire to work on cutting-edge technology solutions in a dynamic environment on Cloud platforms, on-premises at SEB, and hybrids there between, we want to hear from you.
   

  

 About the role:
   

  

 As a Platform Engineer in the WAF team, you will play a crucial role in contributing to, optimizing and managing our enterprise security layers for applications at SEB. You will work alongside a team of skilled professionals to ensure seamless development, management, troubleshooting, and integration. Your technical expertise and problem-solving skills will be essential in maintaining the security, stability and performance of our systems.
   

  

**Key responsibilities:**
* Implement and maintain security layer solutions for applications.
* Ensure reliable operations.
* Continuously identify opportunities for innovation.
* Troubleshoot issues and develop effective solutions.
* Be part of on-call rotation outside office hours.
* Ensure compliance.


**To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**
* Experience with WAF and/or load balancing, preferably using F5 products
* Solid troubleshooting and problem-solving experience
* Network knowhow
* Security awareness
* See Cloud technologies as an opportunity
* A habit to ideate, prototype and verify several solutions both individually and in group to determine a great solution
* Communication skills in Swedish and English


 What we offer:
   

  

* A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions and points of views
* Exciting ongoing cloud transformation journey
* Collaborative and dynamic work environment
* Opportunities for professional growth and development
* Competitive compensation and benefits package
* Hybrid workplace


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 If you are a highly motivated team player with a strong background in WAF/Network security layers, troubleshooting and a desire to contribute to our cloud transformation journey, we encourage you to apply.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 28th of March 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact Katarina Pihl, Talent Acquisition Partner at katarina.pihl@seb.se, but please be aware that we can not handle applications through email due to GDPR.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Solution Owner
description:
***St1 Biokraft is looking for an experienced Solution Owner to lead data management efforts and create business value through data-driven insights.***




  





**A Powerful Partnership** 




 St1 Biokraft is a joint venture between St1, HitecVision, and Aneo, combining expertise and resources to drive innovation in the biogas industry. The aim is to become a leading integrated biogas player in the Nordics, contributing significantly to the energy transition. The company covers the entire biogas value chain, from feedstock sourcing to distribution and end-user sales, with a goal to achieve 3 TWh biomethane production and 6 TWh biomethane sales by 2030, focusing on heavy transport, maritime, and industrial applications.
 



  





 To support this expansion, over 1 billion EUR will be invested in biogas production and distribution networks across the Nordics, with several major projects already underway, aimed at enhancing the infrastructure and scaling up operations to meet ambitious targets.
 



  





**Solution Owner** 




 St1 Biokraft is looking for an experienced Solution Owner to lead data management efforts and create business value through data-driven insights.
 



  





 The Solution Owner will be responsible for defining and delivering data management solutions that generate measurable value for the business. This includes building and maintaining a modern data platform, ensuring precision, scalability, and security. This role is located in Stockholm and reports to the Head of IT.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Designing and implementing a robust, future-proof data platform.
* Establishing and implementing frameworks for data governance and quality.
* Developing and maintaining data models and processes for the entire data lifecycle – from collection to deletion.
* Ensuring data security and compliance in line with regulations and standards.
* Developing strategies and creating clear roadmaps for future data architecture and management.
* Collaborating with internal and external stakeholders to ensure the solutions meet business needs.



  





**Qualifications** 




 We are seeking someone with deep technical expertise and strategic ability, combined with a passion for creating effective, innovative solutions. You have experience in:
 



  




* Building and maintaining a modern data platform to support business growth and development.
* Defining and implementing frameworks, processes, and standards for data governance.
* Technical architecture and data integration.
* Data security and regulatory compliance.
* Collaborating with diverse stakeholders, both internally and externally, to deliver long-term value.
* Leading complex projects with a focus on cost-efficient solutions.



  





 Additionally, you stay up to date on the latest developments in data management, IT security, and analytical tools. A collaborative mindset is essential for success in this role.
 



  





**Why St1 Biokraft?** 




 At St1 Biokraft, sustainability isn’t just an ambition – it’s at the core of everything we do. You will have the opportunity to be part of an innovative organization where your work truly makes a difference through data-driven solutions. With great freedom and responsibility, you will contribute to shaping the future of biogas and sustainable energy.
 



  





**Application** 




 Interested? Apply today and join St1 Biokraft – a workplace where your expertise makes a difference. Do you have questions about the role or the company? Don’t hesitate to contact us!
 



  





 Submit your application to our recruitment system (for data security reasons, we cannot receive applications by e-mail). Do you have any questions? Please contact our recruitment manager, Pernilla Borgström, at +46 734-159855 or pernilla.borgstrom@st1biokraft.com.

title: Senior IT Consultant - Stockholm | BCG Platinion
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Do you want to turn the challenges of digitalization into the solutions of the future? Join BCG Platinion in tackling the core IT issues of leading global companies. Deploy customized platforms, architectures, strategies, and organizations to leverage the digital potential of our customers and drive true innovation, with state-of-the-art tools such as cloud computing, AI, blockchain, microservices, and containerization. Add your individual strengths to our unique team, always there to support you. Together with Boston Consulting Group and our clients, we turn digital visions into reality.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 For our Stockholm office, we are looking for Senior IT Consultants to collaborate with colleagues from BCG Platinion and/or The Boston Consulting Group on national and international client projects! You will be independently structuring project modules and supporting junior project members. Together with our clients, you will develop superior IT strategies, concepts, and solutions actively and on site, applying your sound technical know-how, your understanding of business contexts, and your analytical and conceptual skills.
   

  

 What You'll Bring
   

  

**You can help us make a difference if you**
* completed a university degree in computer science, informatics, engineering, business or a related field with higher-than-average grades
* bring a minimum of four years relevant experience in IT consulting, in the course of which you ran transformation and implementation projects in terms of both strategy and operations
* have led project teams of more than three people
* know exactly what the buzzwords machine learning, cyber resilience, DevOps, agile, AI, and robotics mean
* are familiar with all the stages of development for successful IT organizations and IT processes.
* know exactly how to put together complex business cases
* feel particularly comfortable in interdisciplinary teams and global contexts and are flexible and willing to travel
* are on a fluent level of understanding and communicating complex topics in English


 Who You'll Work With
   

  

**Shape the world of tomorrow**
* Form the digital transformation of globally leading companies while maintaining a clear view of overall technical solutions and client circumstances
* Drive groundbreaking projects forward by using agile methods and modern approaches within the scope of strategic IT implementation for clients and by actively steering the relevant modules
* Smooth the path for tailored, future-oriented customer journeys based on precise analysis of the situation and with current market developments and trends such as machine learning in mind
* Design and optimize unique IT architectures within the framework of enterprise solution requirements, modern custom software developments, and sustainable digital solutions, including cyber resilience


 Additional info
   

  

**How To Grow With Us**
 We guarantee constant development incentives in an open and rewarding work environment! Together with a dedicated team of talented colleagues, you get to work on new challenges every day. Individual training offers and a culture of open feedback will provide the framework needed to explore and perfect personal strengths. Our modern structures allow focusing on the essence of our work - with easy travel booking, an excellent back-office support and comprehensive Knowledge Center. With our regular office Fridays and legendary events, we nurture a strong and close team network beyond our case work.
   

  

*BCG Platinion is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable.*
*#BCGPlatinion*
 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Optimization & Control Engineer
description:
Do you want to shape the future of clean energy? Join Fortum as an Optimization and Control Engineer and be at the forefront of innovation! This is your chance to be part of a groundbreaking digital venture, Hiven, that revolutionizes market-leading demand response solutions. You will work alongside a talented team of senior and junior specialists, playing a pivotal role in Fortum’s ambitious digitalization and AI journey.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Join Fortum’s Data Science & Optimization team as a key player in our digitalization and AI journey. You will develop Hiven, our market-leading demand response solution, by creating efficient optimization and control solutions that meet customer needs and electricity market regulations.
   

  

 Your responsibilities include:
   

  

  

* Developing scalable forecasting, optimization, and steering algorithms
* Creating aggregation methods for scalability
* Designing tractable approximations when necessary
* Collaborating with backend and frontend teams on interfaces
* Supporting data scientists and ML engineers
* Learning about power system stability and testing requirements
* Coaching the team on system stability, tractability, and performance


 You will work closely with designers, developers, data scientists, and testers to achieve these goals.
   

  

 The positions can either be based in Sweden and Solna or Finland and Espoo.
   

  

**About You**
 We believe you are the perfect fit if you have a passion for innovation and a strong background in engineering and computer science.
   

  

 Here is in detail what we are looking for:
   

  

  

* A master's degree in computer science, Engineering, or equivalent work experience
* Over 4 years of experience in stochastic control and optimization
* More than 3 years of solid software engineering experience, preferably in Python
* At least 2 years of experience working with cloud solutions, especially AWS
* Knowledgeable in statistics and data science with at least 1 year of hands-on experience
* Familiarity with GitHub Actions service deployment, containers, and DevOps practices
* A firm grasp of software engineering principles such as SOLID and clean code
* Excellent communication skills and a keen interest in the energy sector
* Full professional proficiency in written and spoken English


 In addition to these core competencies, it would be a great advantage if you also have experience in the following areas:
   

  

  

* Machine Learning and Generative AI
* Electricity and flexibility markets
* Electrical vehicle chargers or home energy management systems
* Forecast models and parameter tuning
* Data engineering, including architecture development and deployment
* IT security, high availability, cybersecurity, maintenance, and support
* Data storage and maintenance methods
* Message brokers and microservice architectures
* Basic knowledge of OCPP, MQTT, and IoT devices
* Working in an Agile environment


 Join us on this exciting journey where you will collaborate with a dynamic team to shape the future of energy. Your innovative ideas and technical prowess will help drive our mission forward.
   

  

**We offer you**
 At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.
   

  

 More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.
   

  

**Interested?**
 Please submit your application by 2025-02-28 at the latest. We will process the applications continually, and the position will be filled as soon as the right candidate is found, which may be before the last application deadline, so please apply as soon as possible. If you have any questions regarding the process or the position, please contact Kristofer Jakobsson, Head of Data Science & Optimization, kristofer.jakobson@fortum.com. For questions about Hiven, please contact Jani Leirimaa, CEO and founder of Hiven Energy, jani@hiven.energy.
   

  

 To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance, as well as a health examination which may include a drug test.
   

  

**We are Fortum and Hiven**
 Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonize their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our :5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com
   

  

 For us working with start-ups and innovation means faster renewal and keeping up to date with the latest technologies. We want to be right at the forefront of innovation, dreaming up a better tomorrow. Therefore, Fortum invests time and resources in supporting innovation and start-ups, both internally and externally.
   

  

 Hiven is one of Fortum’s digital ventures for a cleaner future. Hiven is an innovative new service for companies wanting to deliver greener and smarter services to their customers. Hiven’s products include services such as smart charging with cloud-to-cloud connectivity to electric vehicles and electric vehicle chargers – and smart heating with cloud-to-cloud connectivity to heating appliances. All these devices are connected to Hiven to be steered in a smarter way.

title: Backend Developer - Expansion
description:
10% of Europe’s CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we’re making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 You'll be instrumental in scaling our business and enhancing our customer experience through various technical initiatives. As a Backend Developer, you will:
   

  

  

* Build intelligent systems to automate sales operations, enabling our sales teams to focus on what matters most - helping customers make the switch to clean energy. Supporting sales by building sophisticated recommendation engines that suggest optimal product setups based on customer input.
* Develop robust backend services to support our expansion into new markets and regions, ensuring our platform can handle different regulations, currencies, and local requirements.
* Work on comprehensive payment solutions, including prepayment options, direct payments, and instalment plans, making clean energy technology accessible to more households.
* Design and maintain core infrastructure that supports our product catalog and enables rapid addition of new clean energy products and services.
* Work on transforming how people discover and embrace clean energy by creating digital experiences that educate, inspire, and simplify the path to sustainable technology.


**What You Bring To The Team**
* Solid experience with product-driven software development and agile environments
* Experience with Java and Spring Boot
* Automated testing at different levels (unit tests, integration tests etc.)


 We would also expect you to have experience in at least two of the following areas:
   

  

  

* Rapid growth journeys (start-ups, scale-ups, new environments)
* Databases (DynamoDB/PostgreSQL)
* Event driven architectures (Kafka)
* Cloud DevOps (Docker, Kubernetes, continuous delivery, logging, metrics)
* gRPC and Protobuf
* Terraform
* Kanban, Scrum and/or a combination of both


**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities.
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally.
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment.
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* Enjoy working in our brand new office. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan subway station just a few minutes walk away.


 At Aira, we champion next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Senior Fullstackutvecklare med fokus på Android
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Rollen**
 Vi är just nu i en spännande fas där vi migrerar och bygger om hela vår backend till en mikrotjänst arkitektur.
   

  

 Applikationerna driftas av teamen på vår molnlösning i Azure.
   

  

**Ska-krav**
* Flera års erfarenhet av Android-utveckling
* Flera års erfarenhet av programmering i Java och Kotlin
* Erfarenhet av att migrera, refaktorera och underhålla legacy kod
* Erfarenhet av att designa REST APIer
* Erfarenhet av att skriva tester och testbar kod


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med någon molnplattform och då gärna Azure, men även AWS, Google Cloud m.m är meriterande
* Erfarenhet med att sätta upp egna CI/CD kedjor för en applikation i Microsoft DevOps eller motsvarande
* Jira/Confluence/DevOps (Git, Pipelines)
* Erfarenhet av Par- och Mobprogrammering


**Sista ansökningdag: 03-03-2025**
**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Software Development Capability Lead, Common Data Warehouse
description:
**Job ID:
 **28580****
**We are looking for an energic and data driven leader for Software Development Capability Lead position in the CDW domain, leading team of highly passionate data engineers working on building modernized cloud based data warehousing solution for the bank.**
 Welcome to Group Technology, where we pride ourselves on engineering solutions and direct Nordea’s transformation by providing a holistic technological view and structured understanding of the bank, and its surrounding environment to enable the Customer Vision and the Business Strategy.
   

  

 Nordea is a place where traditions meet tomorrow. We’re not just a bank, we’re a tech employer on a mission to evolve finance securely and responsibly. Together, we impact millions of people’s daily lives by ensuring they can access our solutions anytime, anywhere, while safeguarding their personal data and wealth. Join us in making an impact on the banking industry.
   

  

**About Our Team**
 We are responsible for building bank’s Common Data Warehousing solution using state of the art cloud solutions. We add value by providing expert data engineering capabilities and expertise in the data warehousing and data integration areas for many solutions in the bank based on cloud based technologies like Snowflake, and many other modern technologies. As the Software Development Capability Lead, you’ll play a valuable role in taking part of an exciting and ambitious journey towards a modern, resilient target state.
   

  

 Our team collaborates with several different stakeholders, and we value our good team spirit. You would join in truly international cross-country team as we are located in Nordics and Poland. Working with international teams in an inspiring & work-life balanced based working environment, you will have lots of opportunities to expand your skills and advance your career.
   

  

**What you’ll be doing:**
* Leading the team of skilled snowflake developers working across locations - Nordics, Poland and India
* Managing and leading the interface to key Business & Technology stakeholders including ensuring continuous alignment with Technology Business Strategy (workforce, partnerships, standards), as well as with Common Frameworks, guidelines and Tech Standards
* Leading our journey towards developing and modernizing our data warehousing platform
* Championing technology strategies and creating awareness of technology trends and opportunities


**As the Leader you have a crucial role in:**
* Empowering people by identifying individual development opportunities to support growth and encourage them to share own ideas, concerns and learnings
* Developing teams by nurturing a dynamic team culture, that emphasises trust and respect to ensure that everyone understands their unique value and contribution
* Developing and supporting your team members to reach their aspirations and unleash their full potential
* Develop further data driven approach and capabilities to steer our teams and people


**Who You Are**
**Your background and skills include:**
* Have leadership experience and know how to both set direction & challenge the status quo for the greater good of Nordea
* Have strong communication and people skills, have the ability to inspire, motivate and engage
* Are role model for collaboration, empowering own team, inspiring the “Can Do” attitude
* Good at Stakeholder Management at all levels of the bank
* Are result oriented, taking ownership, reaching out and “making things happen”. Basically being customer centric mindset actively seeking value-creation opportunities through technology
* Experience and/or high interest to data driven leadership
* A preferred candidate with an IT technical background (Data warehousing, Databases, Snowflake) enabling the candidate to understand the technical context of the area
* Have strong skills within transformation and project/program management creating proven changes in complex financial environments
* Have knowledge of DevOps preferably from working within financial services institutions


**What We Offer**
 People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, it’s to take their career to the next level. For others, it’s to break new ground within their area of expertise – in other words, with us, you will always move forward.
   

  

 A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.
   

  

 Hybrid working model – we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.
   

  

 Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.
   

  

 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
   

  

**Next steps**
 Submit your application with CV and Cover letter no later than 23/02/2025.
   

  

**The recruitment process consists of the following steps:**
* Preliminary CV selection
* First phone/online interview with hiring leader
* Second online interview with the hiring leader and team member
* Online Assessments and follow up HR Interview with recruiter and hiring leader
* Background checks


**Only for candidates in Sweden:** 
 For union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com .
   

  

**Only for candidates in Poland:** 
 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
   

  

 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
   

  

 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: https://www.nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf
   

  

 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: Platform Engineer with a passion to secure application flows \u007C SEB, Stockholm
description:
Are you passionate about Web Application Firewall (WAF) and Network security solutions? Join our digital transformation!  

At SEB we are embarking on an exciting tech transformation journey and are seeking a talented, motivated and security aware Platform Engineer to join our Web Application Firewall Team. If you have a passion for infrastructure development & maintenance, and the desire to work on cutting-edge technology solutions in a dynamic environment on Cloud platforms, on-premises at SEB, and hybrids there between, we want to hear from you.  

About the role:  

As a Platform Engineer in the WAF team, you will play a crucial role in contributing to, optimizing and managing our enterprise security layers for applications at SEB. You will work alongside a team of skilled professionals to ensure seamless development, management, troubleshooting, and integration. Your technical expertise and problem-solving skills will be essential in maintaining the security, stability and performance of our systems. **Key responsibilities:*** Implement and maintain security layer solutions for applications.
* Ensure reliable operations.
* Continuously identify opportunities for innovation.
* Troubleshoot issues and develop effective solutions.
* Be part of on-call rotation outside office hours.
* Ensure compliance.

 **To thrive in this role, we believe you have:*** Experience with WAF and/or load balancing, preferably using F5 products
* Solid troubleshooting and problem-solving experience
* Network knowhow
* Security awareness
* See Cloud technologies as an opportunity
* A habit to ideate, prototype and verify several solutions both individually and in group to determine a great solution
* Communication skills in Swedish and English

  

What we offer:* A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions and points of views
* Exciting ongoing cloud transformation journey
* Collaborative and dynamic work environment
* Opportunities for professional growth and development
* Competitive compensation and benefits package
* Hybrid workplace

 **Do you want to be part of SEB?**
Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.  

If you are a highly motivated team player with a strong background in WAF/Network security layers, troubleshooting and a desire to contribute to our cloud transformation journey, we encourage you to apply.  

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 28th of March 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact Katarina Pihl, Talent Acquisition Partner at katarina.pihl@seb.se, but please be aware that we can not handle applications through email due to GDPR.  

  

  

Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
company_description: More than 15.000 people work at SEB. Working in SEB means being part of an exciting journey, driven by digital transformation

title: Engineering Manager
description:
**Start****ASAP****Duration****7-9 months**
  
Are you an experienced Engineering Manager with a passion for building high-performing teams and designing highly available, high-transaction systems? We are seeking senior consultants with a strong background in empowering teams and delivering scalable, mission-critical solutions.

### **Key Responsibilities**

* Build and lead engineering teams following the **Empowered Teams** model, similar to practices at Klarna, iZettle, and other leading tech firms.
* Drive team autonomy, ownership, and accountability to foster innovation and rapid product development.
* Design and implement **highly available (99.999%) high-transaction** systems, ensuring performance, scalability, and reliability.
* Collaborate with stakeholders across engineering, product, and business teams to align technical strategies with company goals.
* Provide technical leadership and mentorship to engineers, ensuring best practices in architecture, development, and operations.

### **Key Qualifications**

* Proven experience as an **Engineering Manager, Tech Lead, or similar leadership role** in a fast-paced, high-growth environment such as Klarna, Spotify etc
* Strong understanding of **Empowered Teams** principles and experience applying them in real-world settings.
* Deep expertise in operating **high-availability (99.999%) systems** handling high transaction volumes.
* Proficiency in modern cloud technologies, microservices architecture, and distributed systems.
* Excellent leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills.
* Experience working in fintech, e-commerce, or other high-scale industries is a plus.

**The Details**

* Start: ASAP
* Duration: 6 months
* Location: Hybrid setup from Stockholm

  
Alex Kouchmeshki
Country Manager

title: Program Manager - SW League
description:
Qualifications:
**Role and Primary Responsibilities: Program Manager – Software League*** The role focuses mainly on managing the scope of Building Advisor (BDP), and its dependencies with the Building Ecosystem (EBO, Building Data Platform, etc.), Digital Supply Chain and so on.
* Shared responsibility with Product Management and R&D for the **successful delivery & launches of your offer roadmaps**
* **Orchestrate the coordinated objectives and dependencies in close partnership with the teams and functions involved**: Product Management, R&D, 3rd Party Suppliers, Purchasing, Digital Supply Chain, Launch..
* **Ensure best in class governance, rituals and communication to manage your scope (Progress reviews, milestones/events…)**
* Regularly publish information to ensure visibility, transparency, and escalation
* Drive significant efficiencies in our Offer Creation & Lifecycle from our **Agile initiatives**
* Efficient strategic portfolio management & planning cycles (backlogs, roadmaps…)


Also:

* Put customer and quality at the center of our Offers
* Drive culture of continuous improvement (in SAFe/Agile environment)
* Motivate and challenge teams to deliver according to plan
* Be a leader of leaders with business and system thinking mindset
* Manage and be accountable for the key metrics of your scope: time/schedule/predictability, cash out, quality, flow, velocity, WIP limit…
* Focus on managing critical path and risks, not mainly on tasks tracking
* Ensure business decision-making throughout the team & process
* Ensure capacity management in sync with resource managers
* Ensure proper preparations for business cases and future projects

 **Required skills and experiences*** Bachelor’s Degree in related field
* **Strong people skills**, also in communication, risk assessment, change management, stakeholder management, and the ability to influence and convince
* **Experience releasing Software**
* **Good Agile experience**
* Strong knowledge and understanding of business needs

 **Preferred*** Some years of project & program management in software & cloud solutions
* Some years of technical experience
* Experience launching products to global markets
* Understanding of offer strategy and ability to identify solutions
* SAFe certification (SPC, LPM or other)
* Cloud, SaaS/DaaS and IoTPMP or other certification
* Building management knowledge (BMS)

 **What do we offer you?**  

This is a great opportunity to join Schneider Electric and power your career! You will be joining an international, dynamic, and responsible company, with an enviable reputation in the market. Schneider fosters the development of all its’ people around the world. Every day, we empower employees to achieve more and experience exciting careers. Find out how our values and unique position make Schneider Electric the employer of choice – apply now. **Others:**
Compelling Compensation: Base + Bonus + Insurance benefits + Company pension plan
About Our Company:

When you are thinking about joining a new team, culture matters. At Schneider Electric, our values and behaviors are the foundation for creating a great culture to support business success. title: Receptionist, heltid
description:
Vi söker en nu en ny stjärna till vårt fantastiska team i receptionen. Din roll som receptionist är enormt viktig och vi ser gärna du är en dedikerad person med en naturlig fallenhet för service, bemötande och att skapa minnesvärda upplevelser för våra gäster.

  

The Sparrow Hotel, Stockholms färgstarka och chica boutiquehotell med varm, avslappnad och personlig service. Hotellet består av 87 rum och sviter, mitt i stan två minuter från Stureplan, nära allt och alla. Hotellets hjärta är vår franska vinbar och bistro skapad av Mathias Dahlgren.
  

The Sparrow Hotel drivs av Grand Group, där även Grand Hôtel Stockholm och Lydmar Hotel ingår.

**Vem är det vi söker?**

* Din roll som receptionist är placerad på The Sparrow Hotel men som receptionist sköter du även kommunikation och bokningar med gäster via olika kanaler.
* Du ska ha service ut i fingertopparna och ha erfarenhet av gästbemötande, helst i hotellmiljö. Att leverera personlig och högklassig service är något som faller dig naturligt, och du har lätt för att växla mellan att arbeta i team och självständigt.
* Du har en positiv attityd, ser möjligheter i det mesta, är engagerad och vill vara delaktig i vår strävan att varje dag bli ännu lite bättre och skapa minnesvärda stunder för våra gäster.
* Du talar och skriver svenska och engelska obehindrat. Ytterligare språk är starkt meriterande
* Du är flexibel och ser inga hinder för att arbeta dag/kväll under vardagar och helg.
* Du skall vara bekväm i att arbeta själv delar av tiden och andra tider i fullt tempo med andra kollegor.

**Dina egenskaper**


Du uppskattar en härlig energi på din arbetsplats där du är med och sprider den. Du vet vad personlig service i världsklass innebär och du brinner för att skapa en varm, professionell och minnesvärd känsla hos våra gäster som dröjer sig kvar. Du är inte rädd för att hugga i där det behövs och du trivs med att arbeta självständigt. Här jobbar vi i ett litet team där vi hela tider hjälper varandra och där teamwork är dreamwork.


Det absolut viktigaste för oss är att du är rätt person som besitter rätt inställning. Du är ansvarstagande, snabbtänkt, självgående och lösningsorienterad samt har en känsla för små och stora detaljer. Att du älskar att ge service och kvalitet och har ett personligt värdskap ser vi som en självklarhet. Om du dessutom är en charmig och sympatisk person med en känsla för vad våra gäster vill ha innan de ens vet det själva: då är det här jobbet för dig!

**Vad erbjuder vi?**


En ansvarsfull tjänst som Receptionist på ett av Stockholm mest personliga och inbjudande boutique-hotell.


Vi önskar att just du har:

* Erfarenhet av Opera, Opera Cloud eller likvärdigt hotellbokningssystem.
* Erfarenhet från hotellbranschen.
* Har vanan och erfarenheten från receptionsarbete.


Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning om 100%. Arbetstiden är efter rullande schema/skift och vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning.


Tillträde snarast och lön enligt överenskommelse, vi tillämpar kollektivavtal.


Vill du veta mer eller söka direkt till så kontakta Rooms Division Manager, Albin Ydmark Buhre på albin.buhre@thesparrow.se


Som en del av rekryteringsprocessen utför vi bakgrundskontroller via Verifiera.


Varmt välkommen till oss på the Sparrow Hotel där vi tillsammans skapar Sparrow moments!

title: Platform Engineer inom Molntjänster i Sundsvall
description:
Placeringsort
Sundsvall
Diarienummer
FK 2025/004482  



*Varje år fattar Försäkringskassan 24 miljoner beslut som påverkar människors liv och hela samhället. Vi betalar ut cirka 250 miljarder kronor varje år. Det är allas skattepengar vi har hand om. Det är ett stort ansvar. Därför tänker vi nytt och använder den senaste tekniken för att förenkla och förbättra, utveckla och leverera it-tjänsterna för den svenska socialförsäkringen. Välkommen till en av Sveriges största it-avdelningar.*
Inom produktområdet Plattform & Integration ansvarar vi för hela livscykelhanteringen av våra produkter inom Integration, Plattform, Container, Databas och IAM. Detta inkluderar utveckling, implementering, drift och förvaltning för att säkerställa stabila och effektiva plattformstjänster.



Kunskapsutbyte är en integrerad del av vårt arbete. Vi erbjuder kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling, möjligheter att utforska ny teknik och tid för lärande, vilket skapar en dynamisk miljö för professionell utveckling.


**Molnplattformar, Containerteknik, Cloud Native, Open Source**
---------------------------------------------------------------



Som tekniker inom produktområdet Plattform och Integration blir du en viktig del i utvecklingen och förvaltningen av Försäkringskassans plattformstjänster. Du kommer att arbeta i en privat molnmiljö där du hanterar hela livscykeln för plattformens olika komponenter, från utveckling och implementering till drift och optimering.



I den här rollen får du utforska och implementera ny teknik, inklusive AI och open source-lösningar, samt ta ansvar för molnplattformar byggda på containerteknik. Du kommer att vara involverad i onboarding av nya Cloud Native-produkter, vidareutveckling av självservicegränssnitt, samt förbättring och optimering av plattformsinfrastrukturtjänster.



Arbetet innebär även tvärfunktionellt samarbete med andra tekniska team, där du får möjlighet att dela kunskap, bidra till automatiseringsprocesser och vidareutveckla Försäkringskassans system.



Vi söker dig som trivs med problemlösning, innovation och effektivisering och som har en stark teknisk grund inom containerteknik, infrastrukturtjänster och programmering.



Tjänsten innebär att du hanterar sekretessbelagda uppgifter vilket ställer höga krav på rätt hantering. Därför är det viktigt att du som ska arbeta hos oss har högt säkerhetsmedvetande.



Det är ett jobb för dig som vill vara med och ta ansvar.



Vi söker dig som


* har högskoleexamen eller erfarenheter och kvalifikationer som kan prövas likvärdiga
* har erfarenhet av Containerteknik som Kubernetes eller Docker
* har erfarenhet av arbete i Linux
* agerar på eget initiativ och tar ansvar för att nå goda resultat
* samarbetar effektivt med andra för att nå gemensamma mål
* har ett systematiskt och noggrant arbetssätt
* kan förstå och analysera komplexa frågor
* har god kommunikativ förmåga
* har goda kunskaper i svenska, i tal och skrift.


Det är meriterande om du har


* har tekniska färdigheter inom data beskrivningsformat, ex Yaml, Json och Xml
* har tekniska färdigheter inom Infrastrukture as Code IaC
* har tekniska färdigheter inom Datasäkerhet
* har tekniska färdigheti Python, Bash eller Golang
* har kunskap om Git och GitOps
* kunskap om Cloudnative Produkter
* kunskaper om Helm
* kunskaper om AI.


Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.


**Övrigt**
----------



1 tjänst tillsvidare, heltid, med tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Provanställning kan bli aktuellt. Försäkringskassan kan komma att göra viss ekonomisk personkontroll innan anställning. För den här tjänsten krävs svenskt medborgarskap. I den här rekryteringen kommer arbetsprov genomföras för att testa dina tekniska färdigheter och kvalifikationer. Även arbetspsykologiska tester kan komma att användas som en del i urvalsarbetet. Placeringsort: Sundsvall



Vill du veta mer om Försäkringskassan som arbetsgivare? Besök fk.se/jobbahososs


**Kontaktpersoner**
-------------------



Chef: Johan Åberg , 010 114 61 52 (för frågor om tjänsten). HR-specialist: Ahmad Mohsen, 010 113 45 24 (för frågor om rekryteringsprocessen). Fackliga representanter är ST: Christina Lövgren, Saco-S: Per Sandemalm och Seko: Eliza Grundström. Dessa nås via vår växel 08-786 90 00.


**Ansökan**
-----------



Välkommen med din ansökan senast den 16 mars 2025. Ladda gärna upp dina examensbevis, betyg och intyg i samband med din ansökan.



Har du skyddade personuppgifter eller ingen tillgång till bank-id kontaktar du den HR-specialist som finns namngiven i annonsen via telefon så får du hjälp med att skicka in din ansökan.

title: Director - Head of Application Infrastructure Services
description:
The **Volvo Group** drives prosperity through transport solutions, offering trucks, buses, construction equipment, power solutions for marine and industrial applications, financing and services that increase our customers’ uptime and productivity. Founded in 1927, the Volvo Group is committed to shaping the future landscape of sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions. Countless career opportunities are offered across the group’s leading brands and entities that share a culture of Trust, Passion, High Performance, Change and Customer Success.

 **Volvo Group Digital & IT**  

At Group Digital &IT, we have a clear ambition to enable value creation at scale for the Volvo Group. With a new product centric operating model and digital technologies, we will produce digital offerings that are profitable, scalable, and differentiated. With Group Digital & IT, you will be part of a global and diverse team of highly skilled professionals, who learn continuously and embrace change to stay ahead. We have a very important role to play in reaching the Volvo Group ambitions for 2030. Do you want to be part of our transformation journey towards becoming the digital capability of the Group? The time is now.

 **Infrastructure and Onsite Services**  

Infrastructure & Onsite Services (IOS) ensures that best in class infrastructure services are developed, supported and operated. The Function also offers best in class onsite services for factories and warehouses. Furthermore, IOS secures the global provision and support of all needed infrastructure services for the Volvo Group, enabling the digital transformation journey we are undertaking.

  

A vast majority of the infrastructure services are produced by partners where IOS drives the strategic direction. We optimize the setup by securing the right sourcing mix, delivery models and partnerships. The top priority is to drive IT quality and IT security throughout the entire Volvo Group.

  

IOS also manages onsite deliveries of IT infrastructure and End User Services, manages local Business Areas relationships and interfaces, drives systematic continuous improvement to reduce downtime and create business value.

 **Application Infrastructure Services**


Application Infrastructure Services is part of the Application Services department within Infrastructure & Onsite Services (IOS). The mission of Application Infrastructure is to develop and govern the Infrastructure Services for applications while ensuring their delivery and usage. By that, Application Infrastructure contributes to Volvo Group competitiveness by delivering standardized and fit for purpose infrastructure services, maintaining a balance between time to market, cost, and quality.

 **We are now looking for a Director – Head of Application Infrastructure Services**  

In this role you will be reporting to the Vice President of IOS Application Services and be a member of this management team.

 **Wanted Profile**

  

We are looking for an inspiring leader with proven experience in application infrastructure, operations, and automation. You have strong leadership skills, guiding both direct teams and cross-functional colleagues. With a structured approach, you set direction, drive change, and make decisions with confidence.


You are familiar with the ITIL framework and can manage diversity in a global, multi-cultural environment. Collaboration and trust-building come naturally to you. Your leadership aligns with Volvo's core values: [link]. This role offers professional and personal development in an exciting global setting.

 **Application Infrastructure Services Scope**

* **Application Hosting** – Platforms for Mainframe, IBM, OpenVMS, .NET, Java, Storage, X86 hardware, SAP, and Cloud.
* **Integration & BI** – Infrastructure for Integration, EDI, and Business Intelligence.
* **Shared Cloud Infrastructure** – A common cloud layer for Volvo’s public cloud services.

  

You will lead a high-performing team and drive service maturity to the next level.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

 **Service Strategy & Development**

* Define service strategy, roadmaps, and innovation.
* Oversee service development, project steering, and financials.
* Contribute to Volvo Group Digital & IT long-term planning.

**Service Delivery & Outsourcing Management**

* Ensure service quality, cost efficiency, and supplier compliance.
* Manage incident/problem resolution and operational processes.
* Handle financial, contractual, and commercial aspects of outsourcing.
* Oversee budget, cost monitoring, and supplier negotiations.

**People & Stakeholder Management**

* Lead direct reports and partner-managed teams.
* Collaborate with Group Digital & IT and other internal stakeholders.

**Product Management**

* Manage retained infrastructure products.
* Align with DevSecOps models for service development.

 **Required competencies and experience**

* University/master’s degree or relevant experience in Application Infrastructure
* Service oriented mindset and business mindset
* Experience of governance: directing, planning, budgeting and governance of IS/IT services
* Experience of IT outsourcing / managed services
* Proven experience in leading, developing and coaching people
* Experience from leadership in a global context
* Strong experience with Application Infrastructure
* Experience with steering of projects and programs
* Excellent communication & presentation skills

 **Required leadership skills**

* Ability to drive for results
* Excellent prioritization skills and ability to eliminate roadblocks
* Strategic thinker, with ability to simplify complex information into simple themes, highlight key issues and communicate accordingly
* Strong customer focus
* Making complex decisions
* Getting work done through others (lead through others)
* Managing work processes
* Engaging and Inspiring others
* Acts with integrity and creates trust

 **We can offer**

  

You get an opportunity to work together with highly skilled colleagues in an exciting, global environment which provides opportunities to develop both professionally and personally. You will work in close collaboration with various stakeholders inside as well as outside the Volvo Group.


At Volvo Group we are actively working to establish teams that will take maximum advantage of the strengths inherent in differences in knowledge, experience, age, gender, nationality, etc.

* **Location:** Gothenburg, Lyon or Ghent
* **Travel required:** Occasional

  

Application screening will start immediately, we look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible.

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Digital & IT** is the hub for digital development within Volvo Group. Imagine yourself working with cutting-edge technologies in a global team, represented in more than 30 countries. We are dedicated to leading the way of tomorrow’s transport solutions, guided by a strong customer mindset and high level of curiosity, both as individuals and as a team. Here, you will thrive in your career in an environment where your voice is heard and your ideas matter.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Sales Engineer
description:
As a Sales Engineer at Rapid7, you will partner closely with our Sales and Go-To-Customer team as the technical point of contact to new and existing customers across all of Rapid7’s award winning solutions. If you are comfortable going toe-to-toe in a technical discussion with engineers before shifting gears and having a business value conversation with a CIO, this may be the opportunity for you**!**

**About the Team**

  

Our Sales Engineering team partners closely with our Account Executives in a pre-sales role to develop and position solutions involving Rapid7's security solutions. This team consists of a group of driven colleagues where there is a lot of synergy between them. Due to the smaller size of the local team, you can really make an impact and ride on future growth.

**About the Role**


The Sales Engineer works as an equal partner with our sales and Go-To-Customer team in matching up customers with Rapid7's security solutions. You will be required to possess presentation-ready knowledge and product expertise on all Rapid7's product groups, with specialised expertise in the security solutions.


As a Sales Engineer, your primary responsibility will be to understand and articulate the value of our solutions, the Rapid7 story and answer the question, ‘Why Rapid7?’ to prospects, peers, partners, customers and the public.


Specifically, your focus will be to:

* Conduct in-person and remote product demonstrations, working closely with Sales Account Executives to present the technical value proposition
* Engage with the customer as their technical contact throughout the pre-sales evaluation cycle, demonstrating how Rapid7 products meet the customer’s business and technical needs.
* Assists sales in technical qualification
* Engage with channel partners in the region to provide technical sales training and support for partner led-opportunities.
* Provide on-stand demonstrations at Rapid7 seminars or events and industry trade shows
* In pursuit of the above, expect to travel up to 50% of the time within the Nordics region

**Requirements**


The skills and traits you’ll bring include:

* A real passion for learning new skills and technologies
* A genuine interest in helping your customers achieve their goals
* The ability to relate to and engage members of both the technical and non-technical community
* The ability to be self-driven, enthusiastic and determined to succeed
* An understanding of the sales process and the roles and responsibilities involved
* A high degree of personal responsibility as you may be working partially from home/remotely

**Critical Core Skills & Behaviours**

* Strong problem-solving skills to identify and prioritise impactful solutions over routine tasks.
* Ability to align technical solutions with business objectives to drive measurable outcomes.
* Anticipates customer challenges and industry trends, proactively addressing them before they become roadblocks.
* Builds strong relationships with internal teams and customers to create momentum toward shared goals.
* Comfortable making decisions and driving progress without requiring full consensus at every step.

**Role-Specific Skills**

* A technical background, preferably in the Security space
* Expertise in one or more cloud environments. For example; AWS, Azure, GCP or Oracle Cloud
* In-depth knowledge of multiple Operating Systems and Security Solutions
* Highly competent interpersonal skills in Swedish (other Nordic languages would be beneficial) and English.
* Must be able to present effectively in front of large groups, both technically and non-technically oriented.


We know that the best ideas and solutions come from multi-dimensional teams. That’s because these teams reflect a variety of backgrounds and professional experiences. If you are excited about this role and feel your experience can make an impact, please don’t be shy - apply today.


#LI-FB1

title: Senior Data Analyst (Data Visualization)
description:

We are hiring **Senior Data Analyst (Data Visualization)** for the position based in **Stockholm, Sweden (Remote within Sweden or EU)**.


**Educational Qualification:** Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a Related field.


**Job Summary:**



We are Seeking a highly skilled **Senior Data Analyst** with expertise in SQL, Power BI, Looker Studio and will be responsible for data extraction, analysis, and visualization, transforming complex datasets into actionable insights for stakeholders. This role requires strong analytical skills, experience with Google Cloud Platform, and the ability to communicate findings effectively.


**Required Experience/Competences:**


* **7-8 years** of experience in **data analytics, digital analysis, or business analysis**.
* **SQL expertise**, with experience in **Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery)** preferred.
* Proficiency in **Power BI and/or Looker Studio** for data visualization.
* Strong experience in **data analytics and business intelligence**.
* Knowledge of **Python or R** for data processing and analysis.
* **Advanced Excel** skills for handling large datasets and automation.


**Soft Skills:**


* Experience working within a global marketing or analytics team.
* Familiarity with marketing attribution models and customer segmentation.
* Ability to identify and implement automation in reporting and analytics.

* In pursuit of the above, expect to travel up to 50% of the time within the Nordics region

**Requirements**


The skills and traits you’ll bring include:

* A real passion for learning new skills and technologies
* A genuine interest in helping your customers achieve their goals
* The ability to relate to and engage members of both the technical and non-technical community
* The ability to be self-driven, enthusiastic and determined to succeed
* An understanding of the sales process and the roles and responsibilities involved
* A high degree of personal responsibility as you may be working partially from home/remotely

**Critical Core Skills & Behaviours**

* Strong problem-solving skills to identify and prioritise impactful solutions over routine tasks.
* Ability to align technical solutions with business objectives to drive measurable outcomes.
* Anticipates customer challenges and industry trends, proactively addressing them before they become roadblocks.
* Builds strong relationships with internal teams and customers to create momentum toward shared goals.
* Comfortable making decisions and driving progress without requiring full consensus at every step.

**Role-Specific Skills**

* A technical background, preferably in the Security space
* Expertise in one or more cloud environments. For example; AWS, Azure, GCP or Oracle Cloud
* In-depth knowledge of multiple Operating Systems and Security Solutions
* Highly competent interpersonal skills in Swedish (other Nordic languages would be beneficial) and English.
* Must be able to present effectively in front of large groups, both technically and non-technically oriented.


We know that the best ideas and solutions come from multi-dimensional teams. That’s because these teams reflect a variety of backgrounds and professional experiences. If you are excited about this role and feel your experience can make an impact, please don’t be shy - apply today.
