 christian.abrahamsen@saint-gobain.com

title: Manager - Stockholm | BCG Platinion
description:
Who We Are
   

  

 Do you want to turn the challenges of digitalization into the solutions of the future? Join BCG Platinion in tackling the core IT issues of leading global companies. Deploy customized platforms, architectures, strategies, and organizations to leverage the digital potential of our customers and drive true innovation, with state-of-the-art tools such as cloud computing, AI, blockchain, microservices, and containerization. Add your individual strengths to our unique team, always there to support you. Together with Boston Consulting Group and our clients, we turn digital visions into reality.T371
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

 As a Manager at BCG Platinion in the Nordics, you are responsible for the execution and management of our national and international client projects. We collaborate with colleagues from BCG Platinion and/or the Boston Consulting Group on site and directly with the client company. The Manager role incorporates structuring the project and performing the required resource planning. Besides the functional navigation of the project members, you will also be involved operationally in the project business. Together with our clients, you will develop convincing IT strategies, concepts and solutions, applying technical know-how and extensive experience in structuring IT projects, just as analytical and conceptual skills. We independently support our clients, present our results to their decision makers, and agree on the next steps. Shape the world of tomorrow Independently contribute to build close client relationships - and as their trusted advisor, you are the first to whom they turn Acquire new projects and challenges for our company and yourself Be in charge of planning, leading, and assuring quality for strategic IT projects - we work with passion for our clients' long-term success Get to use your comprehensive knowledge of technology and industry understanding to provide both internal and external stakeholders with the orientation they need in critical project phases and challenging situations Think across projects and connecting factors, and plan resources to achieve the best efficiency possible Take ownership for presenting key project results at the highest level of client management Work with an entrepreneurial approach and passion to advance BCG Platinion with your contributions to people development, recruiting, and practice areas You can help us make a difference if you bring a completed a degree in computer science, (business) informatics, or a related area with above-average grades have at least eight years of substantial experience in IT consulting and the lead design and management of IT strategy and implementation projects already captured project-related management experience as the lead of teams with more than five people know how to plan IT initiatives and build solid business cases optimally steer decisions towards the goal and master escalating situations with an eye to solutions - even in complex organizational structures have successfully acquired consulting projects are excellent at understanding and communicating complex topics in English How to grow with us We guarantee constant development incentives in an open and rewarding work environment! Together with a dedicated team of talented colleagues, you get to work on new challenges every day. Individual training offers and a culture of open feedback will provide the framework needed to explore and perfect personal strengths. Our modern structures allow focusing on the essence of our work - with easy travel booking, an excellent back-office support and comprehensive Knowledge Center. With our regular office Fridays and legendary events, we nurture a strong and close team network beyond our case work. BCG Platinion is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where
   

  

 Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
   

  

 BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

title: Mid-Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 Develop, architect and scale the core infrastructure for Sinch's web applications. Be part of in a small cross functional team that sets its own objectives and goals with responsibility for every stage of product development life cycle from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring and maintenance, you build It you run it.
   

  

 Your work will be focused around the common platform used to that makes up the core of the product line; The code you write will be consumed by used by many different teams and is a key enabler in the product line. You will solve problems across the enterprise, focusing not only on how to deliver a great product today but setting the foundations for the future.
   

  

**Tech Stack:** 
 NodeJS, Java, React, Typescript
   

  

**Requirements**
* A strong software engineering background
* In-depth knowledge of the web platform and ecosystem
* Expertise in modern front-end technologies.
* Solid track record working with Typescript in a professional or open-source setting.
* Experience building services on the backend
* Fluency in English


**Good to have**
* Experience using design systems
* Experience making architectural decisions that have high impact
* Experience with Web components and the latest Web APIs
* Experience with AWS, Kubernetes and other cloud native technologies


**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Azure tekniker
description:
Är det du vi söker?
   

  

 Som Azure Cloud Tekniker hos oss kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i vårt team, arbeta nära våra kunder och arkitekter i en mängd olika och stimulerande projekt. Din uppgift blir att medverka i leveransen av molnbaserade infrastrukturlösningar. Tillsammans med våra arkitekter kommer du att bygga, implementera och förbättra Azure-baserade lösningar, såsom att flytta applikationer och hantera andra delar av projekt och kunduppdrag. Du och ditt team ansvarar för att implementera nya funktioner och tekniska lösningar inom Azure för våra kunder.
   

  

 Vad vi förväntar oss av dig:
   

  

* Erfarenhet inom IT-infrastruktur, med fokus på Azure eller andra molnlösningar.
* Teknisk kompetens inom Microsofts infrastruktur- och plattformstjänster i Azure.
* Van att arbeta med IT-infrastruktur och molnlösningar.
* Förmåga att kommunicera väl på engelska i både tal och skrift.


 Personliga egenskaper vi tror på för att trivas i rollen:
   

  

* En proaktiv och positiv inställning.
* Starkt intresse för Azure, med en önskan att ständigt lära och utvecklas.
* Förmågan att arbeta självständigt och i team.
* Ansvarsfullhet och en positiv syn på samarbete.
* Entusiasm för att utforska och implementera nya lösningar.
* Motiveras av projekt som gör skillnad för både företaget och kunderna.


 Om B3 Cloud: Som experter på molnteknik och framtidens digitala arbetsplats, assisterar vi våra kunder i att övergå från traditionell infrastruktur till molnet. Vi erbjuder analyser, planering, migrering och förvaltning av IT-miljöer. Vi hjälper även kunder att uppnå modern samverkan och effektiv informationsdelning med Microsoft 365. B3 Cloud är en stolt Guldpartner och Cloud Service Provider (CSP) till Microsoft.
   

  

**Är du intresserad?** 
 Kände du igen dig i beskrivningen och är redo för en ny utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan nu och låt oss berätta varför B3 borde vara din nästa arbetsgivare! Observera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via e-post, men vid frågor, kontakta Melinda på melinda.andersson@b3.se.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer om förmånerna hos oss? Här är några:
   

  

* Konkurrenskraftig lön.
* Frihet att styra din egen arbetsdag.
* Stora möjligheter till personlig utveckling.
* Interna utbildningar genom Cloud Skolan.
* Årliga konferensresor, sommar- och julfester.
* Regelbundna sociala aktiviteter, allt från After Works till frisbeegolf.


**Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!**
*Som en del av B3-koncernen, är B3 Cloud rankad som Sveriges tredje bästa arbetsplats 2021 av Great Place to Work, utsett till Sveriges IT Karriärföretag 2022 och 2023, samt vann utmärkelsen Årets Karriärföretag 2022. Vi lever efter våra värdeord: erfarenhet, mångfald och energi, och satsar på hållbarhet i alla led. Vi tror att medarbetare som mår bra presterar bättre och har därför B3 Team som anordnar aktiviteter inom wellness, från yoga och löpning till musikquiz och föreläsningar om stresshantering och mental hälsa.*

title: Data Scientist
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Climate Data and Analytics
description:
**Data Scientist** 




  





 Do you want to design cutting-edge AI and ML solutions, work with advanced data models, and empower businesses with innovative analytics?
 



  





 Nexer Insight is looking for a talented Data Scientist to join our team in Stockholm, Malmö, or Gothenburg. We invite you to embark on an exciting journey where you'll work with fascinating clients, tackle varied and challenging tasks, and enjoy exceptional benefits. At Nexer Insight, we are committed to leveraging advanced analytics, machine learning, and AI to drive innovation and deliver impactful solutions for our clients.
 



  





**Nexer Insight** 




 Nexer Insight is a company that embodies entrepreneurship and innovation. As a Data Scientist with us, you'll work with cutting-edge technologies, including LLMs (Large Language Models), RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), and advanced AI solutions. We value teamwork, professional growth, and a vibrant community spirit. With us, you'll have the opportunity to work on exciting projects, collaborate with experts in the field, and make a meaningful impact in the intersection of data science and AI.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Develop advanced AI/ML models and design solutions leveraging LLMs for various AI use cases, including RAG and intelligent agents.
* Apply machine learning, statistical methods, and predictive modeling to solve real-world problems.
* Build and deploy data pipelines and cloud-based architectures for ML workloads and MLOps.
* Innovate and collaborate with clients to discover new business opportunities and develop tailored solutions.
* Work with NLP, computer vision, and containerized applications to deliver high-impact projects.
* Leverage platforms like Azure Databricks, Azure Data Lake, and Azure ML for scalable and efficient workflows.
* Promote best practices for data science, from architecture and data quality to reliability and performance.



  





**Who You Are** 




 We expect you to have:
 


* Minimum 4 years within Data Science
* Strong understanding of LLMs and experience building solutions on top of them for AI-driven solutions.
* Experience with RAG and AI-driven agents.
* An analytical mindset and strong business acumen.
* Problem-solving aptitude and a proactive mindset.
* Hands-on experience with applied ML, statistics, and cloud architectures for MLOps.
* Proficiency in Python, PySpark, and familiarity with tools like Databricks.
* Knowledge of computer vision, NLP, SQL, and containerized apps.
* Experience with Azure cloud services such as Azure ML and Azure Data Lake.
* Fluency in Swedish and English.



  





  





**Why Nexer Insight?** 




 At Nexer Insight, we invest in our employees by providing professional development, certifications, and a vibrant working culture. With us, you'll be part of a team pushing boundaries and using advanced data science to create meaningful solutions for leading clients.
 



  





 Are you ready to take the next step in your career and explore the forefront of AI and data science? Apply today and join us on this exciting journey!

title: Service Delivery Director
description:
****Join Telavox as Service Delivery Director 🌎****
 Telavox is looking for a customer Service Delivery Director to oversee critical operator projects, ensuring successful delivery while driving innovation, efficiency, and quality in telecom and cloud communication solutions.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll drive initiatives that streamline project management, refine solution architecture, and optimize service delivery processes for excellent customer outcomes.
   

  

**About The Job**
 As the Service Delivery Director, you will align technical delivery with business objectives. You’ll lead major customer engagements, oversee complex projects, and ensure solutions are designed and delivered to meet the highest standards. In this role, you will also collaborate closely with sales teams, contributing to pre-sales efforts and enabling commercial management to ensure our solutions meet technical and business objectives. While the primary focus is hands-on project management, your efforts will shape a scalable and efficient delivery function, aligning with Telavox’s global ambitions in UCaaS and Telco solutions.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead and manage projects by planning and delivering key Operator initiatives, ensuring timely execution within budget and scope.
* Optimize Service Delivery by developing scalable workflows and processes that drive efficient, high-quality customer service delivery.
* Collaborate on solutions by partnering with Solution Architects to design tailored, customer-centric architectures for telecom services.
* Strengthen client relationships by acting as the primary project interface for Operators, managing engagements to meet KPIs, and fostering long-term partnerships.


**About You**
 This role is ideal for a strategic and hands-on leader who thrives in dynamic environments and is motivated by the opportunity to shape scalable delivery functions aligned with Telavox’s global ambitions.
   

  

 We’re looking for an experienced professional with a technical background and an ability to manage complex projects. You thrive at building relationships across technical, operational, and commercial dimensions while driving impactful results.
   

  

**Key Qualifications And Skills**
* With telecom expertise, you bring in-depth knowledge of VoIP, UCaaS, SIP, PBX systems, and cloud-based communication solutions, enabling you to manage modern telecom challenges effectively.
* Your project leadership skills are evident in your track record of successfully managing large-scale projects for Tier 1 Operators, consistently meeting or exceeding delivery KPIs.
* Leveraging your solution architecture expertise, you excel in designing scalable, secure, and reliable telecom solutions that align with customer needs.
* Focusing on customer engagement ensures you have strong experience managing client relationships and delivering exceptional outcomes that exceed expectations.


**We Like You To Have**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business, or a related field.
* Experience in telecom and software project delivery, particularly within the Operator domain.
* A strategic mindset combined with hands-on execution capabilities.


 At Telavox, we foster a culture of innovation and collaboration. Based in our Malmö or Stockholm office, you’ll be part of a fast-growing, inclusive team that values your expertise and contributions. This is your opportunity to make a real impact and advance your career with a company at the forefront of UCaaS and telecom solutions.
   

  

****Why Telavox? 💚****
 Since Telavox's journey started in 2002, we have strengthened our position as the leading forward-thinking communication platform for businesses. We offer Telephony, PBX, messaging, meetings, and contact centres in one simple platform. Unlike our competitors, we own our platform and develop everything ourselves in-house.
   

  

 Today, we are a fast-growing and profitable company with +1.9b in revenue and +500 Telavoxers in nine countries. We pride ourselves on creating an inclusive, supportive culture where everyone can thrive.
   

  

 By joining us, you will not only contribute to our technology but also be part of a company that values work-life balance, continuous learning, and community. Plus, you will enjoy our legendary company events, personal development opportunities, and much more 😀
   

  

**Are you interested in becoming part of Telavox? Apply now!**
 At Telavox, we don't focus on fitting in; we focus on making room for everyone.
   

  

 Join Telavox, where diversity fuels innovation. Apply now to join a team committed to creating a truly inclusive workplace.
   

  

 Do not miss out on this exciting opportunity to grow your career and make your mark on the future of telecom technology. Send your application our way, and let us explore what we can achieve together!
   

  

 For any questions, feel free to reach out to Talent Acquisition Partner Ami Faraguna at ann-marie.faraguna@telavox.com
   

  

**Due to the holiday season, responses to applications may be delayed. Our team will review all applications and get back to you after January 13th. Thank you for your patience, and happy holidays! 🎄**
**Learn more about what we do! ⬇️**
 Telavox develops world-leading communications platforms with solutions for smart and efficient telephony, PBX, chat and much more. Regardless of whether it involves an entrepreneur-driven startup or a giant among giants, Telavox contributes to making companies more transparent, efficient and accessible.

title: Security Engineer
description:
Trustly is leading the human-centric payments revolution. To us, this means passionately building the most convenient, intelligent and responsible way of paying for things online. Whether it’s for shopping, paying subscriptions, funding trading accounts, booking airfare, playing online games and much more – we’re all about a better way to pay. At our core, we are a tech company with industry-leading tech capabilities. But, it’s the ingenuity of our people that makes us leaders in our field. Thus, our appetite for innovation will never be anything less than fierce. Trustly is steadily growing as it connects thousands of businesses with hundreds of millions of people. And with a strong presence across Europe and the Americas, we are leading the human-centric payment revolution as a truly global team.
 




  





**About the team
 

 As part of fulfilling the objective of becoming the leading global online banking payments provider, we are strengthening our capability in the information and cyber security area. Currently, we are restructuring our internal setup within the security area allowing us to scale and grow our teams.
 









 To get us going we are now looking for additional Security Engineers to join the Security and Compliance team focusing on our product security in Europe.
 





  
 




**About the role
 

 As a Security Engineer at Trustly, you will be part of a team of security professionals ensuring security lies in the core of everything we build and operate. We combine our expertise in providing security services to the organization with automating security controls wherever and whenever possible.
 









 As our team is undergoing an expansive phase, you will have the opportunity to shape our direction and methodologies. Your contributions will be important in refining our interactions with merchants, allowing you to leave a large impact on our operational security framework.
 





  




**What you’ll do** 
* Ensure our vulnerability management program maintains coverage of all applicable assets, by building automation that makes sure our tools are up to date and supports our teams to keep our software secure
* Perform security assessments and provide security guidance of the product we build through design reviews, code reviews as well as performing dynamic testing, working closely with the development teams
* Research and implement security controls on top of the CI/CD pipeline
* Design and execute internal penetration testing activities
* Compromise our hosts and data with exploitation of vulnerabilities to assess actual risks involved and understand what controls that failed to protect
* Proactively gather threat intelligence and build tools that enable us to identify and act on external threats efficiently and intelligently



  




**Who you are** 
* You have spent a few years in the area of cyber security doing hands-on technical security work
* Detailed technical knowledge of techniques, standards and state-of-the art capabilities for authentication and authorisation, applied cryptography, security vulnerabilities and remediation
* DNS, TLS, X.509, CVEs and SOAR/SIEM systems are no strangers to you
* Experience from hands-on technical security assessments such as penetration tests, web application tests, code reviews etc
* Passionate about working with application developers in "shifting left", introducing security controls early on in the development process
* Any security certification (e.g. OSCP, OSWE or similar)
* Bachelor/Masters/PhD degree in Computer Science or Cybersecurity is considered a plus






  




  


 Kindly submit your application and CV in English.
 











  






 Are you someone who voices new ideas and acts on them? Do you value great communication with all stakeholders? We are looking to strengthen the team with dedicated, highly motivated people who thrive in working with different areas across the organisation.
 









 If you feel that your skill set and personality compliments the criteria above, apply now and k
 

 indly submit your CV in English.****

title: Technical Account Manager
description:
**Description**
 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
   

  

 AWS Enterprise Support, Technical Account Managers (TAM) support our customers’ creative and transformative spirit of innovation across all technologies - including Compute, Storage, Database, Big Data, Application-level Services, Networking, Serverless, Deployment, Security and more. This is not a sales role, but rather an opportunity to be the principal technical advisor and ‘voice of the customer’ to organizations ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500 enterprises.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 As a TAM working with Enterprise customers, you will help craft and execute strategies to drive our customers’ adoption and use of AWS services - including EC2, S3, DynamoDB & RDS databases, Lambda, CloudFront CDN, IoT, and many more.
   

  

 Your technical acumen and customer-facing skills will enable you to effectively represent AWS within a customer’s environment, and drive discussions with senior leadership regarding incidents, trade-offs, support, and risk management.
   

  

 You will provide advocacy and strategic technical guidance to help plan and build solutions using best practices, and proactively keep your customers’ AWS environments operationally healthy. The close relationships developed with your customers will allow you to understand their business/operational needs and technical challenges, and help them achieve the greatest value from AWS. This position will require the ability to travel 10% or more as needed.
   

  

 Watch a short video about life as a Technical Account Manager here: https://bit.ly/3aHfaE0
   

  

 The TAM is the centerpiece of value to our Enterprise Support customers. If you wish to be at the forefront of innovation, come join us!
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS ?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

**Work/Life Balance**
 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
 Experience with operational parameters and troubleshooting for three (3) of the following: compute/storage/networking/CDN/databases/DevOps/big data and analytics/security/applications development in a distributed systems environment
   

  

 3+ years experience in Informational Technology operations Internal enterprise or external customer-facing experience
   

  

**Preferred Qualifications**
 Preferred Fluency in English & Swedish
   

  

**Experience With AWS Services Or Other Cloud Offerings**
 Experience in internal enterprise or external customer-facing environment as a technical lead
   

  

 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)
   

  

 Job ID: A2904222

title: Sales Executive - BI & Planning
description:
*Som Sales Executive på Staria kommer du ha en central roll i att driva försäljningsprocessen för vår innovativa BI & Planning-lösning. Du kommer att vara med och bygga långsiktiga och värdefulla affärsrelationer, och få möjlighet att påverka vår fortsatta tillväxt. Låter det som något för dig? Läs då vidare!*
**Om rollen**
 Som den ledande NetSuite-partnern i Europa har vi upplevt stora framgångar och förväntar oss nu en liknande tillväxt inom BI & Planning. Som Sales Executive - BI & Planning, kommer du att vara drivkraften bakom vår tillväxt inom försäljning av vårt BI & Planning-verktyg, Naviloq.
   

  

 Din roll är central i att identifiera och utveckla nya affärsmöjligheter och rollen innebär att du har det huvudsakliga ansvaret över hela säljprocessen – från att hitta potentiella kunder och etablera kontakt till att skapa affärsförslag och stänga affärer. I ditt arbete kommer du att ha stöd från både marknad och en dedikerad Business Development Manager, men prospektering är naturligt en del av ditt arbete och kräver ett självständigt och proaktivt arbetssätt där du aktivt bygger relationer och söker nya möjligheter. I nära samarbete med kollegor (fellow Starians) kommer du att:
   

  

* Prospektera
* Driva säljprocessen framåt
* Delta och engageras i demos
* Skapa offerter och avtal
* Planera implementeringar


 Din förmåga att skapa förtroende hos kunder och kommunicera värdet av vår lösning kommer att vara avgörande för framgång i rollen. Ditt initiala fokusområde kommer att vara den nordiska marknaden, med en möjlighet att utvidga ansvarsområdet till EMEA-regionen i takt med vår tillväxt.
   

  

 På Staria värdesätter vi flexibilitet och erbjuder därför en hybrid arbetsmodell där du själv kan styra varifrån du arbetar. Om du föredrar att kunna ta dig till ett kontor när så önskas, är du är varmt välkommen till ett av våra mysiga kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Jönköping, Halmstad, eller Malmö.
   

  

**Vem vi letar efter?**
 Vi söker en säljare med erfarenhet inom B2B-försäljning, med fördel erfarenhet inom BI- och planeringslösningar, som exempelvis Power BI, Qlik, SAP Analytics Cloud, eller liknande verktyg. Denna erfarenhet kommer ge dig bra förutsättningar för att snabbt förstå vår produkt och hur den kan möta potentiella kunders behov.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen är du en proaktiv och målinriktad person som trivs i en uppsökande säljroll. Du motiveras av att hitta nya möjligheter, skapa kontakt och bygga långsiktiga affärsrelationer. Din förmåga att kombinera strategisk förståelse för marknaden och produkten med ett hands-on-sätt att angripa försäljningen gör dig framgångsrik i att driva affärer från start till slut.
   

  

 Som person är du självgående, resultatorienterad och en naturlig relationsbyggare. Du är bekväm med att ta kontakt med potentiella kunder och trivs med att arbeta i en dynamisk miljö där du får frihet att påverka och forma ditt eget arbete. Flytande svenska- och fullständiga yrkeskunskaper i engelska är nödvändiga.
   

  

**Varför Staria?**
 ✨Vi erbjuder en spännande möjlighet att arbeta med en modern produkt som tillför något nytt och spännande till marknaden. Vi tillhandahåller stöd när det gäller marknadsföring, affärsutveckling, produkthantering och pre-sales, vilket ger dig möjlighet att briljera i din roll. På Staria främjar vi en tillväxtorienterad miljö, och din karriär kommer att utvecklas tillsammans med vår organisation. Vårt säljteam har en stark känsla av kamratskap och samarbete, där kollegor bryr sig om varandra och arbetar tillsammans mot gemensam framgång. Vi prioriterar en stödjande miljö framför hård konkurrens, vilket gör att alla kan trivas och glädjas åt det de gör. Lär känna ditt potentiella framtida team genom att klicka här.
   

  

 ✨På Staria kommer du att vara en del av en stabil, framgångsrik och internationell organisation där expertis i toppklass möter en vänlig, låghierarkisk arbetsmiljö. Vi prioriterar ditt välbefinnande och din utveckling och har erhållit Future Workplaces-certifieringen som ett bevis på vår utmärkta medarbetarerfarenhet.
   

  

 ✨Vi erbjuder dig genuint flexibla arbetstider och alternativ för distansarbete, även från utlandet. Samtidigt erbjuder vi möjligheter att få kontakt med dina kollegor genom kontorsfrukostar, team-dagar och evenemang.
   

  

**Låter detta intressant?**
 Om denna möjlighet låter spännande för dig, skicka då in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, men senast
 **24 februari, 2025** 
 . Vi granskar ansökningar under hela ansökningsperioden och är beredda att snabbt gå vidare om vi hittar rätt kandidat.
   

  

 Har du frågor eller behöver mer information? Kontakta då ansvarig rekryterare på emina.dedeic@staria.com. Av GDPR-skäl accepterar vi endast ansökningar via vårt rekryteringssystem.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_
   

  

 Staria stärker tillväxtbolag med globala redovisningstjänster, ERP-konsultation och BI- & planing-lösningar. Vi arbetar dedikerat för att stödja våra kunders tillväxt genom våra expertrådgivningstjänster och skräddarsydda lösningar. Som det enda företaget i Europa att kan leverera finansiella tjänster och lösningar till över 40 olika länder genom ett enda dedikerat team, är vi stolta över vår unika position på marknaden. Med ett team på över 550 medarbetare i olika 7 länder drivs vi av våra värderingar kring samarbete, mod och engagemang. Bli en del av vårt arbete kring att forma framtiden för finansiering hos tillväxtbolag.

title: System Sr Sales Rep
description:
**Job Description**
 We are looking for someone who is looking for an overall sales responsibility for a sales territory in Sweden with a mix of large public and private customers. She or he should own the full sales responsibility from a systems point of view and develop this territory. Understanding off Private Cloud and hardware technology and how to create compelling business cases is highly desirable to be able to position our sales across the full Systems portfolio of products.
   

  

**What you’ll bring:**
* Possess a good high-level understanding of server, storage, services, associated Software, and how superior solutions can brings value for our customers.
* A self-motivated team player who excels at cultivating strategic relationships on all levels while developing new business within the given territory.
* Responsible and accountable for growth, value, strategy, customer satisfaction, through relationship management, cross-selling, innovation, thought leadership and financial management.
* Generate and achieve weekly territory forecasts, and accurately predict revenue monthly; manages escalation
* Assist in the development of short-, medium-, and long-term plans to achieve strategic objectives
* The ability to influence thinking or gain acceptance of others in sensitive situations is important.
* Language skills: Swedish and English.


 Career Level - IC4
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**Responsibilities:**
* Works towards an allocated Hardware target
* Driving sales through the entire sales cycle, from demand generation programs through to closed business and Partners’ and Customers’ references
* Maintaining a deep understanding of the market and identifying and prioritizing the key opportunities for Oracle within that market
* Manage the sales process for establishing market visibility and deal visibility.
* Manages opportunities to obtain appropriate and necessary resources for all qualified opportunities.


**About Us**
 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s problems. True innovation starts with diverse perspectives and various abilities and backgrounds.
   

  

 When everyone’s voice is heard, we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. It’s why we’re committed to expanding our inclusive workforce that promotes diverse insights and perspectives.
   

  

 We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.
   

  

 Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer a highly competitive suite of employee benefits designed on the principles of parity and consistency. We put our people first with flexible medical, life insurance and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
   

  

 We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by calling +1 888 404 2494, option one.
   

  

**Disclaimer:**
 Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer\*. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.
   

  

* Which includes being a United States Affirmative Action Employer

title: Key Account Director
description:
Ebury is a leading global fintech company that empowers businesses to trade and grow internationally. It offers a comprehensive suite of products, including international payments and collections, FX risk management, trade finance, and API integrations. Founded in 2009 by Juan Lobato and Salvador García, Ebury is one of the fastest-growing global fintechs, with over 1,700 employees and 38 offices in more than 25 countries.
   

  

**Key Account Director - Stockholm**
**4 days working in the office & 1 day from home**
 Our Key Account Directors are the heartbeat of our sales floor, experts in what they do and role models for how they do it. You’ve put in the hours building client relationships, building your knowledge and building your reputation. Now you’re ready to step up onto a bigger stage to showcase your sales talents with an international brand, inspiring the next generation of FX sales people at Ebury as you lead the charge for new business.
   

  

**About The Job**
 As a FX Sales Director, you’ll be focused on building your career in sales, driven by targets and a highly competitive commission structure while making a lasting impression on a vast client base.
   

  

* Originate new business targeting client prospects (£50M+ turnover).
* Sell cash management, FX hedging and payment products.
* Understand the client's business, strategy and challenges to provide the best Ebury solution for their situation.
* Support our strong client relationship/servicing culture through on-going customer contact, written call reports via Salesforce, quality customer service and superior product knowledge


**Why Join us?**
* Industry leading basic salary and the opportunity to quickly increase your earnings through a transparent commission scheme.
* Great product suite including Trade Finance with more products in development
* Rapid career progression and a range of structured career paths including leadership, account management/dealing.
* Training and mentoring from some of the world’s most experienced and successful FX professionals.
* International development opportunities including attending global bootcamps.
* Career development opportunities and support to relocate and work abroad.
* Spacious and modern office in Central Stockholm


**You…**
* Have a proven track record of exceeding sales quotas and market share goals in the FX industry.
* Are able to develop sales strategies, techniques and tactics based on customer feedback and market environment; presenting key selling points, features and benefits.
* Are a skilled negotiator and communicator, able to build and leverage relationships at senior levels, including C-suite, within international companies.
* Are relationship focused, nurturing long-term commercial relationships resulting in repeat business and network referrals.
* Have a good understanding of the needs and goals that a business has from a treasury & budgeting perspective.
* Speak fluent Swedish & English


**About Us**
**Ebury is a FinTech success story, positioned among the fastest-growing international companies in its sector.**
 Founded in 2009, we are headquartered in London and have more than 1700 staff with a presence in more than 25 countries worldwide. Cultural diversity is part of what makes Ebury a special place to be. From Sao Paulo to Dubai, Bucharest to Toronto, we enjoy sharing team experiences and celebrating success across the Ebury family.
   

  

 Hard work pays off: in 2019, Ebury received a £350 million investment from Banco Santander and has won internationally recognised awards including Financial Times: 1000 Europe's Fastest-Growing Companies.
   

  

 None of this would have been possible without our proudest achievement: our great people. Enthusiastic, innovative and collaborative teams, always ready to disrupt and revolutionise the fast-paced FinTech sector.
   

  

*We believe in inclusion. We stand against discrimination in all forms and have no tolerance for the intolerance of differences that makes us a modern and successful organisation. At Ebury, you can be whoever you want to be and still feel a sense of belonging no matter your story because we want you and your uniqueness to help write our future.*
*Please submit your application on the careers website directly, uploading your CV / resume in English.*

title: Senior IT-säkerhetsspecialist – SOC Level 2
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vill du arbeta i frontlinjen mot cyberhot och stärka säkerheten för oss själva och för våra kunder?
   

  

 Vi söker en erfaren och engagerad Senior IT-säkerhetsspecialist till vårt Security Operations Center (SOC).
   

  

 I denna roll får du möjlighet att analysera och hantera säkerhetshot, samtidigt som du utvecklar vår tjänst och vägleder både kunder och kollegor.
   

  

 Du kommer att vara en nyckelspelare i vårt team och arbeta med avancerade säkerhetsutredningar, incidentrespons och forensiska analyser – allt i en dynamisk och prestigelös miljö där vi ständigt strävar efter att höja kvaliteten på våra leveranser.
   

  

 Placeringsort: Stockholm, Malmö eller Göteborg
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

* Övervaka, analysera och hantera säkerhetshändelser i våra kunders mest kritiska IT-miljöer
* Agera vid säkerhetsincidenter och genomföra säkerhetsbedömningar för att minimera risker
* Bidra till att utveckla och förbättra SOC-tjänsten genom automation och processeffektivisering
* Stötta teamet i den dagliga verksamheten och höja kvaliteten på leveransen
* Delta i kunddialoger och presentationer samt ge rekommendationer för att stärka cybersäkerheten
* Vid behov delta och/eller leda i incidentrespons och forensiska utredningar


 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker en analytisk och lösningsorienterad specialist med stark förståelse för IT-säkerhet och nätverk. Du trivs i en roll där du får ta egna initiativ och bidra till utvecklingen av både tjänsten och teamet.
   

  

**Vi ser gärna att du har:**
* Relevant akademisk examen inom IT-säkerhet, nätverk, data eller motsvarande arbetslivserfarenhet
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i en SOC-miljö, gärna på Level 2 eller högre
* Goda kunskaper inom IT-säkerhetsverktyg (SIEM, IDS/IPS, SOAR)
* Förmåga att leda projekt och vägleda och utveckla juniora analytiker
* Mycket goda kommunikationsfärdigheter i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift


**Meriterande:**
* Certifieringar inom IT/Cybersäkerhet (t.ex. CompTIA Security+, CISSP)
* Erfarenhet av molnsäkerhet och drift i Azure, AWS eller Google Cloud
* Kunskap inom säkerhetsarkitektur och säkerhetsramverk
* Erfarenhet av automation & script inom säkerhetsområdet.


 Tjänsten kan vara placerad i säkerhetsklass, vilket innebär att en säkerhetsprövning kan behöva genomföras innan anställning.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
* En stimulerande och tekniskt avancerad arbetsmiljö där du får arbeta med den senaste säkerhetstekniken
* Möjlighet att påverka och utveckla vårt SOC och våra tjänster
* Stöd för vidareutbildning och certifieringar inom cybersäkerhet
* Ett sammansvetsat team med en kultur som präglas av kunskapsdelning, engagemang och innovation


 Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas så snart vi hittar rätt kandidat. Skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
   

  

 Har du frågor? Kontakta rekryterande chef Morgan Ivarsson (morgan.ivarsson@cgi.com) för dialog.
   

  

 Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Microsoft Dynamics 365 Functional Specialist
description:
**Role:** 
 Microsoft Dynamics 365
 **Functional Specialist**
 Location:
 **REMOTE** 
 , but will need to travel every 3-6 months for 1-2 weeks onsite
   

  

 The D365 Functional Specialist serves as the subject matter expert for Microsoft Dynamics 365 applications, bridging the gap between business requirements and technical solutions. This role focuses on analyzing business needs, configuring D365 modules, and delivering functional solutions to optimize operations and achieve organizational goals.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand and document requirements, pain points, and objectives related to integrations needs.
* Review Functional design documents and provide the necessary feedback to implementation team and stakeholder.
* Understanding of Azure and D365 Environments from integration perspective
* Support Product Owner to approve FDD documentation
* Conduct workshops and process mapping sessions to identify gaps and opportunities for process improvement.
* Translate business requirements into functional specifications for D365 related to integrations
* Stay updated on D365 updates, new features, and industry trends to recommend enhancements.
* Proactively identify areas for system optimization and improvement in alignment with business goals.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive innovation and streamline operations.
* Dealer Management System knowledge is added advantage


**Skills And Qualifications**
* Experience: Proven expertise in configuring and supporting Microsoft Dynamics 365 modules
* Knowledge: Strong understanding of business processes in Finance
* Analytical Skills: Ability to analyze complex business requirements and translate them into effective D365 solutions.
* Communication: Strong interpersonal and communication skills to engage with stakeholders at all levels.

title: Senior Fullstack Android/Java/Kotlin
description:
**Om kund**
 Ett av Sveriges ledande tågbolag, har i uppdrag att bedriva lönsam persontrafik. Varje dag genomförs 440 tågavgångar till 160 stationer runt om i landet.
   

  

**Uppdragsbeskrivning**
 Kunden söker en senior fullstackutvecklare med inriktning på Android till ett av deras fem produktteam inom IT Trafik och Service. Teamet ansvarar för utveckling och förvaltning av egenutvecklade system för planering och trafikledning – system som är affärskritiska och därför utvecklas i nära samarbete med slutanvändarna. Just nu befinner de sig i en spännande fas där backend-miljön migreras och byggs om till en mikrotjänstarkitektur. Applikationerna driftas av teamen i kundens molnlösning på Azure.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Du är en kommunikativ lagspelare som trivs i en verksamhetsnära miljö, där social förmåga och en positiv attityd är avgörande. Du tycker om problemlösning och delar gärna med dig av din kunskap till andra. Med ett genuint intresse för ny teknik håller du dig uppdaterad inom ditt område och strävar alltid efter att utvecklas professionellt.
   

  

 Du har en stark vilja att hjälpa både ditt team och andra när behov uppstår. Din problemlösningsförmåga gör att du gärna dyker ner i kod, samtidigt som du tar ansvar för att leverera hållbara lösningar. Dessutom ser du värdet i att förstå användarnas beteenden för att kunna driva en effektiv utveckling som löser verkliga problem.
   

  

**Kompetenser och färdigheter**
* Flera års erfarenhet av Android-utveckling
* Flera års erfarenhet av programmering i Java och Kotlin
* Erfarenhet av att migrera, refaktorera och underhålla legacy kod
* Erfarenhet av att designa REST APIer
* Erfarenhet av att skriva tester och testbar kod


**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med någon molnplattform och då gärna Azure, men även AWS, Google Cloud m.m är meriterande
* Erfarenhet med att sätta upp egna CI/CD kedjor för en applikation i Microsoft DevOps eller motsvarande
* Jira/Confluence/DevOps (Git, Pipelines)
* Erfarenhet av Par- och Mobprogrammering


**Språk**
 Goda kunskaper i Svenska och Engelska både i tal och skrift
   

  

**Start:** 
 2025-03-03
   

  

**Längd:** 
 11 månader
   

  

**Slut:** 
 2026-01-31
   

  

**Plats:** 
 Hybrid/Stockholm 2-3 dagar på plats

title: Konsultchef till RentalCare
description:
**Är du en driven säljare med passion för relationer och affärer? Vill du ta din karriär till nästa nivå i ett växande företag?** 
 🚀 RentalCare är en ledande aktör inom vårdbemanning i Sverige och Norge och nu söker vi efter fler engagerade Konsultchefer som vill vara med på vår resa.
 



  





  





  





**Om RentalCare** 




 RentalCare är ett dynamiskt säljbolag med hjärta för vården. Vi specialiserar oss på att matcha rätt kompetens med rätt arbetsplats inom vårdsektorn. Vår styrka ligger i våra långvariga relationer med både kunder och konsulter och vi fortsätter att växa snabbt på marknaden.
 



  





**Din Roll** 




 Som Konsultchef hos oss är din huvudsakliga uppgift att driva relationsbaserad försäljning. Du kommer att bygga och vårda ett starkt nätverk av högkvalificerade kandidater inom vården och matcha dessa med de uppdrag vi får in från regioner och kommuner. Du ansvarar för hela försäljningsprocessen, från första kontakt till förvaltning av relationen, för att säkerställa att både kunder och konsulter är nöjda.
 



  





  





**Vad du kommer att göra:** 



* **Identifiera och rekrytera toppkandidater** 
 : Aktivt headhunta och attrahera rätt talanger till företaget.
* **Bygga långsiktiga relationer** 
 : Skapa och upprätthålla starka band med både nya och befintliga konsulter.
* **Driva försäljning** 
 : Kontakta och sälja in företaget till kunder inom både privat och offentlig sektor.
* **Utveckla innovativa lösningar** 
 : Skapa nya samarbetsmöjligheter som gynnar alla parter.
* **Förhandla och säkra avtal** 
 : Ansvara för att förhandla avtal som maximerar värde för alla inblandade.
* **Administrera och följa upp** 
 : Säkerställa att all dokumentation och uppföljning sker enligt våra höga standarder.



  





**Vi söker dig som:** 



* Har några års erfarenhet av försäljning och är redo för mer komplexa affärsutmaningar.
* Har en stark passion för försäljning och personlig utveckling.
* Trivs i ett högt tempo och älskar att sätta och nå höga mål.
* Arbetar proaktivt och har en kreativ och innovativ inställning.


- 


  





**Vad vi erbjuder:** 



* En chans att arbeta i ett framstående och expansivt företag med starka värderingar.
* Möjligheten att göra verklig skillnad genom att matcha rätt kompetens med rätt arbetsplats inom vården.
* Ett dynamiskt arbetsklimat där du uppmuntras att tänka utanför boxen och utvecklas i din roll.



  





**Krav:** 




 Erfarenhet av försäljning
 



 Sysselsättning på 100%
 



 Minst 4 års arbetserfarenhet
 



  





**Meriterande:** 




 Eftergymnasial utbildning
 



 Tävlings-/sportintresse
 



 Erfarenhet av arbete med telefon
 



 Uppvisande av goda säljresultat i tidigare arbete
 



  





  





  





**Vad händer nu?** 




 Vi återkommer till dig så snart som möjligt. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse.
 



  





 Tjänsten är placerad på vårt kontor i centrala Stockholm och du förväntas kunna arbeta på plats.
 







 Vid frågor är du välkommen att kontakta Head of People and Culture, Michaela Winblad, michaela.winblad@rental-care.se. Vi tar ej emot ansökningar via mail.
 



  





*Som en del i vår rekryteringsprocess gör vi bakgrundskontroll på de kandidater som går vidare.*

title: Senior Sustainability Reporting Specialist - Tietoevry CBS (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
**We're Hiring a Sustainability Reporting Specialist**
 Do you have a strong background in
 **ESRS, CSRD** 
 , and solid understanding for the interface between sustainability- and financial reporting? Are you ready to be a part of a vibrating and highly engaged team? If so, we want you on our team!
   

  

**Your Role:**
 As a
 **Sustainability Reporting Specialist** 
 , you will:
   

  

* Lead the annual sustainability reporting project aligned with CSRD and ESRS requirements
* Run the quarterly sustainability reporting
* Be overall responsible for gathering and processing sustainability related data
* Provide expert guidance on sustainability regulations and compliance
* Play a key role in designing and building an integrated reporting approach using the Group’s reporting tools
* Work cross-functionally with internal teams and external stakeholders
* Ensure high-quality, audit-ready reporting in line with EU regulations.
* Head the annual assurance project on behalf of the sustainability team
* Report to the Chief Sustainability Officer and be part of the Group Sustainability team yet with daily collaboration with the financial reporting team


**What We’re Looking For:**
* 5-10 years of experience in sustainability reporting, audit, or advisory.
* Deep understanding of ESRS, CSRD, and other relevant regulatory frameworks.
* Background in a Big Four firm is a strong advantage.
* Project leadership skills with a proactive and results-driven mindset.
* Strong communication and stakeholder management abilities.


**Why Join Us?**
* Work at the forefront of sustainability reporting.
* Take part in the journey of integrating sustainability into core processes of the company
* Be part of a dynamic, mission-driven team.
* Competitive salary and benefits.


**Arrangements**
* Tietoevry office in Espoo, Finland or Solna, Stockholm
* Flexible working hours and hybrid work life


**Onboarding/Start date**
* April/May 2025 or earlier


**About Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
   

  

 Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs.
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Senior Full Stack Developer – Intranet Development | SEB, Solna
description:
Are you a passionate Full Stack Developer looking to make an impact? Do you enjoy working with modern technologies to build and improve digital workplaces? We are looking for a skilled developer to join our team and take our intranet to the next level!
   

  

 SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, you'll be interested in this opportunity!
   

  

**About the role:**
 As a Full Stack Developer, you will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and optimizing our intranet platform. You will work with a modern tech stack, focusing on both frontend and backend development, ensuring a seamless and secure user experience. You will collaborate closely with designers, architects, and stakeholders to deliver high-quality solutions that support our organization’s internal communication and workflows.
   

  

**To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**
* Excellent skills in Optimizely CMS, .NET Core, and Angular
* Design and implement APIs and integrations
* Good knowledge in Docker, Microsoft Azure DevOps and GitHub
* Write and maintain high-quality code with a focus on performance, security, and scalability
* Ensure high test coverage using Playwright, MSTest, and Jest
* Collaborate with the team to understand business needs and translate them into technical solutions
* Optimize authentication flows using Microsoft Entra ID and OpenID Connect
* Work with databases to store and manage content efficiently
* An academic degree or an equivalent qualification


**What we offer:**
* Agile and modern ways of working
* Work with modern technologies in a dynamic and collaborative team
* Influence the future of our intranet and digital workplace
* A great work-life balance with flexible working arrangements


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 11th of March 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact Hiring Manager Stefan Fredberg at stefan.fredberg @seb.se
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEBhere** 
 : www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Systems Engineer
description:
**About this role:**



We are looking for 3 Systems Engineer to join our team, each will have a different expertise. You will either have 1) RF expertise 2) be able to explore innovative leads with customers or 3) ready for development into a Systems role.



These roles are essential to ensure our team delivers cutting-edge, high-performance electronics hardware and sensors for delivering quality projects and products to our customers. All hires will work from our Gothenburg site where occasional hybrid working is possible.



You will be passionate and responsible for the technical development during the development process, including requirements specification for design and verification. You will be involved in a dynamic, fast paced working environment with exciting projects and challenging schedules. You will not be afraid of challenges and happy to get involved!


*These opportunities are ideal for someone looking for development opportunities in the New Space Industry, a technically minded business.*

**Key Responsibilities:**


* Deliver work tasks and assignments in accordance with required standards and compliance requirements
* Lead technical development throughout the projects including ensure we meet timescales, agreed project deliveries and budget
* Motivate and technically lead teams to ensure a high level of performance and delivery
* Resolve any conflicts between contractual obligations and “wants” of the customer/contractor
* Collecting ideas from customers, stakeholders and colleagues to inform our technology developments
* Discuss and form new products and projects
* Manage relationships with key stakeholders and their expectations to ensure their continued support


**Skills required:**


* Relevant degree or equivalent work experience
* Either have RF expertise, be able to explore innovative leads with customers, or be early career looking for development to systems
* Evidence of successfully resolving technical issues
* Evident industry experience of applying systems engineering to products and applications
* Solid understanding of hardware/software product life cycle as appropriate to specialisation
* Excellent customer, communication and stakeholder management skills
* Strong interpersonal skills with the drive to complete tasks on schedule
* Able to interpret technical requirements and ideas
* Ability to drive good decisions under highly demanding, dynamic environment
* Ability to organise self and prioritise workload of multiple projects in dynamic environment with tight deadlines
* Competent IT skills including Microsoft software
* Proficient in English, both verbally and written


**Skills desired:**


* Previous experience working with small/medium sized companies


**About AAC Clyde Space**



AAC Clyde Space, a leading New Space company, specialises in small satellite technologies and services that enable businesses, governments, and educational organisations to access high-quality, timely data from space. This data has a vast range of applications, from weather forecasting to precision farming to environmental monitoring, and is essential to improving our quality of life on Earth.


**Our growing capabilities bring together three divisions:**

* **Space Data as a Service** – delivering data from space directly to customers
* **Space missions** – turnkey solutions that empower customers to streamline their space missions
* **Space products and components** – a full range of off-the-shelf and tailor-made subsystems, components, and sensors


AAC Clyde Space aims to become a world leader in commercial small satellites and services from space, applying advances in its technology to tackle global challenges and improve our life on Earth.



Some of our clients include Horizon Technologies, Orbcomm, OHB Sweden, Intuitive Machines, Orbital Micro Systems, the United States Airforce Academy, UK Space Agency, European Space Agency and NASA.



AAC Clyde Space Group consists of the parent company AAC Clyde Space AB (publ) and subsidiaries in Sweden, the UK, the Netherlands, South Africa and the USA. Our main operations are in these five countries, with partner networks in Japan and South Korea.



AAC Clyde Space’s share is traded on the Nasdaq First North Premier Growth Market.


**Data Protection Policy**



As part of our recruitment process, we collect and process personal data relating to job applicants. We are committed to being transparent about how we collect and use this data, please click here to see our job applicant privacy notice.


**Right to Work**



AAC Clyde Space has a legal responsibility to ensure that all its employees have the legal right to live and work in the EU or the country in which they plan to work. Therefore, if you are made an offer of employment, this will be subject to AAC Clyde Space verifying that you are eligible to work in that country before you start work.


**Equality, Diversity and Inclusion**



We aim to create a positive recruitment and selection experience across every part of our business. The company is committed to handling applications to a consistently high standard and all candidates with dignity and respect. Those involved in the recruitment and selection process will act with integrity, objectivity and professionalism. We are committed to equal opportunities for all and to have diversity reflected within our global workforce. We believe its diversity and inclusion will allow for greater creativity and innovation to help AAC Clyde Space Group deliver the vision to help improve life on earth.


**Openness to Flexible Working**



We recognise work-life balance is important so we are open to discussions around flexible working, depending on the nature of the role and business needs. If you would like to know more, please ask the hiring manager during any recruitment process that you may be involved in.

title: Senior Test Automations Ingenjör inom mjukvara
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



Är du en erfaren Test Automations ingenjör som drivs av teknik, användarvänlighet och kvalité? Har du passion för mjukvarutestning, kvalité och testautomation? Då kan du vara rätt för oss!



Vi söker en Test Automations ingenjör inom mjukvara som vill hjälpa våra kunder inom Q/A området och samtidigt komplettera Mekatronikchefen genom att driva utveckling inom ditt expertområde.



Du har ett genuint intresse för teknikutveckling och vi tror att du på fritiden håller dig uppdaterad inom branschen. Din passion för teknik, människan och affären driver dig att ständigt utforska nya lösningar och möjligheter.



Som Senior Test Automation ingenjör på Sigma Industry Development kommer du att hjälpa våra kunder med att driva strategier och samtidigt vara hands-on inom:


* testramverksutveckling där Python är primära språket
* skriva testfall inom kundens domänområde
* underhålla ramverk och test automations pipe
* programmering med Python
* vana att använda byggsystem och ramverk för mjukvarutestning
* vana att jobba med Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)
* vana att jobba med kvalitativ versionskontroll för källkodshantering ex. GitHub eller GitLab
* vana att jobba med nightly test & daily test ex. Jenkins, GitLab CI eller Travis CI
* vana att jobba med orkestrering och container teknologier såsom Docker

### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**



Vi söker dig som vill vara nära tekniken och är van och trygg i att tekniskt leda andra.


* Ca 10 års professionell erfarenhet inom inbyggda system
* Lång erfarenhet och intresse av att delvis jobba i lab-miljö med kombinationen hårdvara och mjukvara.
* Minst 5 års professionell erfarenhet inom Test Automation området nära R&D och inbyggda system med Python som primärt språk
* Lång erfarenhet som mjukvarutestare i större projekt där produkten innefattar hårdvara och mjukvara
* Erfarenhet av flertalet Linux distributioner för inbyggda system
* Meriterande med professionell erfarenhet inom inbyggda system med C/C++ som primärt språk
* Säkerhet – Förståelse för bästa praxis inom säkerhet för infrastruktur och applikationer.
* Nätverk – Kännedom om nätverkskoncept i Linux miljö.
* Agila metoder – Kännedom om agila ramverk som Scrum eller Kanban.
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


**Utbildning:**



* Civilingenjörsexamen inom datavetenskap, elektroteknik eller motsvarande område.

### **WE OFFER**



Vi är stora nog för att kunna erbjuda en bred kundbas och vi har ett gott rykte i branschen, samtidigt som vi är små nog att se dig som individ. För oss är gemenskap viktigt – här ska alla känna sig sedda och välkomna. Som en följd av detta har vi bland annat gemensamma sektionsaktiviteter, ett nätverk för kvinnor och icke-binära, ett mentorskapsprogam och utbildningar inom olika kompetensområden.



Vi strävar efter att skapa en miljö där alla kan växa och utvecklas tillsammans. Vår ambition är att tillgodose konsultens önskemål gällande uppdragslängd, sektor och arbetsuppgifter. För oss är en bra balans mellan arbete och privatliv en självklarhet och vi är stolta över att vara en av Sveriges mest attraktiva arbetsgivare. Givetvis har vi också kollektivavtal (via Almega).





**Om Sigma Industry Development**

Sigma Industry Development är ett teknik- och konsultbolag inom Sigmagruppen som hjälper både ledande svenska och internationella teknikföretag och innovativa och nytänkande start-ups och scale-ups. Vi verkar inom sektorer så som den gröna energisektorn, fordonsindustrin, transportindustrin, medtech, försvarsbranchen och hållbarhet.



Vår vision är att vara det ledande teknikkonsultbolaget och vår kultur präglas av familjär samhörighet där människan är i centrum. Med över 100 engagerade medarbetare är vi i en stark tillväxtfas. Vår kärnverksamhet ligger i konsultuppdrag ute hos kund, men vi har även ett in-house-team som arbetar uteslutande från kontoret. Precis som vårt namn antyder, är utveckling kärnan i allt vi gör och våra medarbetare engageras av att ta Sigma Industry Development till nästa nivå.



**OM SIGMA GROUP**

Sigma Industry Development AB (SID) är ett av sex dotterbolag som ingår i koncernen Sigma Industry East/North Group, vilka i sin tur ingår i Sigma Group (som ägs av familjekoncernen Danir AB). Läs mer om Sigma Industry Development HÄR och om Sigma Group på HÄR.



Utöver att vara del av ett företag som värnar om teknologisk utveckling, arbetar för en bättre miljö och som främjar jämställdhet, så är en viktig del av vår verksamhet socialt ansvarstagande. Mer information om detta hittar du HÄR.


### **MORE INFORMATION**

  



Kristoffer Billqvist, Sektionschef Mekatronik  

+46 708102082  

Kristoffer.Billqvist@sigma.se



* #### **POSITION**


Senior Test Automations Ingenjör inom mjukvara
* #### **COMPANY**


Sigma Industry Development
* #### **LOCATION**


Stockholm, Sweden
* #### **COMPETENCE AREA**


Software development
* #### **PUBLICATION DATE**


2025-02-18
* #### **EXPIRATION DATE**


2025-03-31
* #### **CONTACT**


Kristoffer Billqvist, Kristoffer.Billqvist@sigma.se, +46708102082
